channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Recriminations and finger-pointing have begun in Russia’s spy and defense agencies, as Ukraine invasion has turned into a costly and embarrassing morass, U.S. officials say https://t.co/HH6CLooFbY

“We are in an aging society,” French President Emmanuel Macron said during his first press conference since declaring he would seek a second term. “It is therefore normal that we work more.” https://t.co/A0T7bgfESO
Our inboxes are mirrors—they reveal how we handle challenges. One full of unanswered emails doesn’t reflect well on its owner. https://t.co/IeddF9J8r3
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has blocked grain exports and curtailed spring planting. Countries world-wide are now relying on a 2022 harvest that may never arrive. https://t.co/5o1tyN2l8x

Today’s headlines echo many wars in the Russian and Soviet past. History records tales of undersupplied Russian conscript soldiers, high inflation and industrial breakdowns during wartime, and tyrants surrounded by flatterers. https://t.co/iby2Ze587D
Elon Musk’s ties to China are causing concern in Washington, including among Republican lawmakers who have been some of the billionaire entrepreneur’s most ardent supporters https://t.co/8svDrFP7OA
NYU students spent nearly two months analyzing Taylor Swift’s songwriting, her feud with Kanye West and whether Jake Gyllenhaal has her scarf. https://t.co/Di2Djop3WH
The real story behind the Pentagon's program to secure biological labs in Ukraine https://t.co/6qKEhsutYt
“I’m working to sever my supply chain from Russia as fast as I can.” U.S. manufacturers with Russian ties are working to figure out how to survive. https://t.co/DK1Ar299QT

Russia’s assault on Ukraine has forced more than 10 million people to abandon their homes, the United Nations said. That means almost a quarter of the country’s prewar population has been uprooted. https://t.co/OMDdylUwxM
Almost one child a second has fled Ukraine since Russian forces began their invasion, the U.N. said on the 20th day of the conflict https://t.co/uRvb2eIjuq

Mariupol’s City Council has accused Russian forces of forcibly evacuating residents of the city’s Livoberezhny district to Russia, as well as the pro-Russian breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine https://t.co/h2vhuFm5XQ
The fighting in Ukraine has caused more than 10 million people to abandon their homes, the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees said Sunday https://t.co/z343cvtJuZ
Disney had a new policy on public political stances: Don't take them. That blew up in its face. https://t.co/TW3x1xXhWx

Pope Francis on Sunday decried the “violent aggression against Ukraine" as a "a senseless massacre," and warned of compassion fatigue for Ukrainian refugees, who he said could soon face exploitation instead of welcome https://t.co/mHRrzPObTm

From @WSJopinion: I had refused masks before, but in a moment of decision when convenience and conviction collided, I chose the former. Shame on me and on everyone who feels as I do and acts as I did, writes Rebecca Sugar. https://t.co/QbmF5Q76iz

After years of turning a blind eye to password sharing, Netflix has had enough. The streaming giant is testing a new feature that will charge customers an extra fee for sharing their accounts with people outside of their household. https://t.co/ZP8uIXgFNE

Russian attacks are endangering Ukraine’s world-leading medicinal chemistry industry, which supplies scientists across the globe with molecular building blocks needed for early drug development https://t.co/dav8b82E6z

Russia spent years trying to wean itself off imported goods to fortify against Western sanctions. But Russia’s continued dependence on imports means it's facing a painful economic readjustment. https://t.co/SQ8ltePsnU
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine threatens a big portion of the world’s wheat supply and points to further inflation of food prices #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/B4Pl2yQjzE https://t.co/CKGzKcXNYL
Russia wants to return to the days when it made do with few imports. But businesses are now dependent on imported parts and foreign software. https://t.co/nm5S68S6y8
The real story behind the Pentagon's program to secure biological labs in Ukraine https://t.co/sb6c9X3IwL
Russia appears to be preparing to reset its forces after more than three brutal weeks of combat and limited ground games in its assault on Ukraine https://t.co/7yJCYkLpar
Cargo ships are accumulating at Shenzhen, one of China’s busiest ports, as a new Covid-19 outbreak raises the prospect of another round of bottlenecks https://t.co/U6bFmaw3xR
Inflation is pinching Dollar General in multiple ways. https://t.co/hgvoQcVJMp
Faced with a record Covid surge, China wants to set aside hard lockdowns in favor of a less disruptive approach. https://t.co/IDyqcKhHVV
Last weekend, Emmanuel Macron was photographed in an outfit that critics said was conspicuously close to what Volodymyr Zelensky has been wearing https://t.co/vmSZakSf6T
A new Omicron variant dubbed BA.2 has been detected in the U.S. but scientists have yet to raise alarms. Here’s what we know so far. https://t.co/MTHuOa4Wiz
It's important to adjust your workouts when you hit 50. Here are some exercises to help keep you strong and safe into the decades to come. https://t.co/jqPvLvkifz
Australia has banned with immediate effect the export of alumina and aluminum ores to Russia as it widens its sanctions on the country over its invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/1vRcvKCaXH

Russia spent heavily to revamp its military. It has floundered in Ukraine, its first major test. “They have never had to operate these complex systems in this kind of conflict since at least the end of the Cold War.” https://t.co/0p4vYFiH2R
Two California lawmakers say children are being harmed by social-media addiction—and technology companies should pay the cost https://t.co/cTWfP4YXF2
The palatial and ornate Manhattan mansions depicted on the hit HBO series "The Gilded Age" once existed, but have almost all been demolished. https://t.co/qGtUQ3sqrr

Today’s headlines echo many wars in the Russian and Soviet past. History records tales of undersupplied Russian conscript soldiers, high inflation and industrial breakdowns during wartime, and tyrants surrounded by flatterers. https://t.co/DbCvclWi26
Russia began the war in Ukraine with the world’s largest tank force but the losses it has suffered reveal its weaknesses on the modern battlefield https://t.co/umvVnhxVHP
Recriminations and finger-pointing have begun in Russia’s spy and defense agencies, as Ukraine invasion has turned into a costly and embarrassing morass, U.S. officials say https://t.co/Mp4BNWlQFM
Ivermectin got loads of attention from celebrities like Joe Rogan as a way to treat Covid-19, but a large study has questioned its effectiveness https://t.co/4oCxQasmBB
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine threatens a significant portion of the world’s food supply when prices were already at their highest level in years https://t.co/8M5tSC0J6k
From @WSJopinion: A show of force inside Ukraine would save lives and deprive Putin of the ability to dictate events, writes Ludovic Hood https://t.co/gTu1mvIytb
Porsche and Apple held early discussions late last year about potential joint projects, the sports-car maker’s chief executive said https://t.co/oEVf34LZLy
A new Vatican constitution published on Saturday opens the way for women to run some offices at the Catholic Church’s universal headquarters that have always been run by men https://t.co/8C5wIrxJBl

Russia’s bombardment of cities, towns and villages is confronting millions of Ukrainians with a painful dilemma: abandon their shattered lives and seek safety elsewhere, or cling on in the hope it passes https://t.co/G9bYulDRAc

McDonald's, Levi's and other U.S. brands flooded into Russia in the 1990s. The attack on Ukraine looks to some like a death knell for the relationship. “It’s certainly the end of an era." https://t.co/FlKdGMLvf9

A tech blockade will hurt Russia’s ability to get sophisticated semiconductors. The country’s chip-building technology lags behind industry leaders’ by more than 15 years, executives say. https://t.co/f6v3cuNnH0

From @WSJopinion: The attempt by Biden to assign blame for the acceleration of prices that began just over a year ago to a war that began just under three weeks ago is remarkable for its cynicism, its dishonesty and its desperation, writes @gerardtbaker https://t.co/uJvaC9zfrR
The scale of Western sanctions caught Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich off guard. “I don’t think he or anyone else expected what would come.” https://t.co/hmULPnctGf
Odessa-based programmer Wang Jixian challenges Chinese fans of Vladimir Putin to put words into action on the battlefield, attracting millions of views https://t.co/07KPTILTiY
Russia said it fired an air-launched ballistic missile on Ukraine in what may have been the first use of the new weapon https://t.co/xygaCqmI4b
Iran set up a clandestine banking system outside the country that handles billions of dollars in banned trade, according to documents and Western officials https://t.co/CItGbd1t59
“Nobody wants to leave the city anymore”: People in this Ukrainian port city are attempting a tentative return to normality after Russian forces were pushed back https://t.co/nbPetFvEZz
